title: Seedlist from 1698
creator: Dutch East India Company
description:
Namen der Ceijlonse bollen en wortelen aen de camer Amsterdam en Zeelandt overgesonden.

The earliest seedlist found in the Company archives, sent from the island of Sri Lanka to Kamer Amsterdam and Kamer Zeeland (two of the six chambers of the Dutch East India Company).
subject: archives;seeds
image_alt_text: scan of an archival document showing a list describing seeds in local languages of Sri Lanka

title: Seedlist from 1725
creator: Dutch East India Company
description:
Twee copia translaat Latijnse notitien van sodanige Ceijlonse zaden als naar Amsterdam en Delft in den jaare 1725 van Ceijlon zijn gesonden opgemkaat bij den botanicus Pieter Hertog (ontfangen den 30 januarij 1726 per 't schip Nederhoven. 

Seedlist from the island of Sri Lanka to Kamer Amsterdam and Kamer Delft (two of the six chambers of the Dutch East India Company).
subject: archives;seeds

title: Seedlist from 1740
creator: Dutch East India Company
description:
Cathalogus der Ceijlonse zaden en planten die in drie bakken en een cas voor de camer Delft en 's lands universiteijt te Leijden overgaan. 

Seedlist sent from the island of Sri Lanka to Kamer Delft (one of the chambers of the Dutch East India Company) and Leiden University.
subject: archives;seeds;university

title: Seedlist from 1777
creator: Dutch East India Company
description:
Copie catalogues van de Ceijlondsche medicinale zaken afgesonden aan de botanie te Amsterdam, 21 Januarij 1777.

Seedlist from the island of Sri Lanka to the botanic gardens in Amsterdam.
subject: archives;seeds;botanic gardens

title: Seedlist from 1788
creator: Dutch East India Company
description: Last seedlist found in the archives, sent from the island of Sri Lanka to the botanic gardens in Amsterdam and Leiden
subject: archives;seeds;botanic gardens

title: Paul Hermann's personal herbaria in 5 volumes
creator: Paul Hermann
description:
These were thought to be Paul Hermann’s personal herbaria. 
Paul Hermann was a botanist working for the Dutch East India Company on Sri Lanka in the late 17th century. 
His materials ended up in Joseph Bank's collection, which later became part of English scientist Hans Sloane's extensive scientific collection.
subject: flora
source:
Natural History Museum, London
Charles E Jarvis (2016). Hermann Herbarium (from Hermann Herbarium) [Data set resource]. Natural History Museum.

title: Icones Plantes Malabaricum
creator: Unknown
description:
A manuscript produced by an as-yet unidentified physician working for the Dutch East India Company in the vicinity of Jaffna in northern Sri Lanka. 
The Latin name of this manuscript may be misleading, as the plants featured are not only from Kerala in India (then-called Malabar coast by the Dutch), but also plants from Sri Lanka. The plants are described using Malayalam, Sinhalese and Tamil names.
subject: flora

title: Drawing: Cinnamon
creator: Unknown
description:
Caruwa, alsoo genaemt bij de Malabaren en bij de Cingaleesen koerundoe, en bij de Hollanders Caneel, De natuur van t'selve is heet, zij heeft een verwarmende, heetmakende, verdrijvende kragt; Zij vallen op Ceijlon.

Caruwa, named by the Malabars and by the Sinhalese koerundoe, and by the Dutch Caneel. It is of a hot nature, has a warming, removing power. Grows on Ceylon.
name: Cinnamomum verum J.Presl; Karuva; Kurundu; Cinnamon
subject: drawing;flora

creator: Unknown
description:
Caruwa, alsoo genaemt bij de Malabaren en bij de Cingaleesen koerundoe, en bij de Hollanders Caneel, De natuur van t'selve is heet, zij heeft een verwarmende, heetmakende, verdrijvende kragt; Zij vallen op Ceijlon.

title: Drawing: Achmella
creator: Unknown
description:
Tippalikamam, alsoo genaemt bij de Malabaren, En bij de cingaleesen Hackmalla is een kleijn kruijt, desselfs kragt door eenige vogt uijtgetrocken, verwarmt de maag, en drijft het water af. Zij vallen veel op Ceijlon.

Tippalikamam, named by the Malabars and by the Sinhalese Hackmalla is a small herb. The juice squeezed from this herb warms the stomach and acts as a diuretic. They grow plentiful on Ceylon.
name: Acmella paniculata (Wall. ex DC.) R.K.Jansen; Tippalikamam; Hackmalla; Toothache plant
subject: drawing;flora

title: Herbarium Vivum
creator: Paul Hermann
description: This herbaria was sent from Paul Hermann to Jacob Breyne, 1672, and later sold to the Gotha court in the 18th century.
subject: herbaria;flora

title: Collectio plantarum Zeylanensium
creator: Paul Hermann; Johannes Burmann
description: This Paul Hermann herbaria was initially sent to Jan Commelin, director of Amsterdam botanic gardens, inherited by botanist Johannes Burmann, later sold by his descendants to Swiss-French botanist Benjamin Delessert.
subject: herbaria;flora;butterfies
source: Bibliotheque de l’Institute de France, Paris
